column4: congrats. I can't delete anything because my install of ubuntu doesn't seem to know what trash is.
Axel: I know how to delete but the system does not recognize that it has a trash applet
I'm looking at a trash desktop icon on my desktop if I click it I get the following error "Could not didsplay "trash:" the file is of an unknown type.
Its vanished from the taskbar and I only got it to get on my desktop via gconf-editor.
right click task bar and simply re add it
Thats the problem. When I attempt to re add it nothing happens
Its like the system doesn't have a trash applet
I can't even browse to it
I attempt to browse to my trash folder and it says that the operation is not supported
I can sort of add a trash icon to the upper task bar but upon attempted use it tells me nautilus had a spawn error.
hmm. anything you remember doing before it went on vacation?
if you need to delete a file, you get an error as well?
I was trying to update Glib
I sort of was still running on the stock 2.0
I did get it to update.
Weisshund I was trying to update Glib
SteelWingI dont have an answer on restoring the trash bin, but shift delete will bypass the bin
Shift Delete does nothin
nothing*
Its like the OS forgot how to remove data. I guess I need to track down a list of dependencies for the trash applet and reinstall them all one by one.
Do Trash or any of the Gnome Applets use Glib?
i dont think so
